digest_items.title: Verify encryption in transit
digest_items.why: Unencrypted data transmission exposes sensitive information
digest_items.fix: Enforce HTTPS for all endpoints and use TLS for internal services

digest_items.title: Use security headers scanner
digest_items.why: Missing security headers leave applications vulnerable to common attacks
digest_items.fix: Use securityheaders.com to scan and implement recommended headers

digest_items.title: Implement rate limiting on APIs
digest_items.why: Rate limits prevent brute force attacks and API abuse
digest_items.fix: Use middleware like express-rate-limit or nginx limit_req module

digest_items.title: Implement zero trust architecture
digest_items.why: Zero trust assumes breach and verifies every access request
digest_items.fix: Require authentication for all resources regardless of network location

digest_items.title: Verify patch management process
digest_items.why: Unpatched systems are vulnerable to known exploits
digest_items.fix: Establish regular patching schedule and test updates before deployment

digest_items.title: Enable audit logging
digest_items.why: Audit logs are essential for incident response and compliance
digest_items.fix: Log authentication events, data access, and configuration changes

digest_items.title: Use secure file upload validation
digest_items.why: Malicious file uploads can lead to remote code execution
digest_items.fix: Validate file types, scan for malware, and store uploads outside webroot

digest_items.title: Use secure cookie flags
digest_items.why: Insecure cookies can be stolen via XSS or transmitted over HTTP
digest_items.fix: Set HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite flags on all cookies
